responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Validation of Shell Command Execution
    analysis: |
      The script "validate_examples.sh" executes all PHP files in the "examples" directory using a for loop. It does not adequately validate or sanitize the filenames before execution. If an attacker can manipulate the filenames or the contents of this directory, they can include malicious files with shell commands, leading to arbitrary command execution.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - validate_examples.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Improper Validation of Shell Command Execution
leads.analysis: The script "validate_examples.sh" executes all PHP files in the "examples" directory using a for loop. It does not adequately validate or sanitize the filenames before execution. If an attacker can manipulate the filenames or the contents of this directory, they can include malicious files with shell commands, leading to arbitrary command execution.
